item.title: sophos grant revoke vpn access to user via ldap
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Sophos: Grant/Revoke Users Access to VPN

Revision History:
    2015-09-09 12:08:08 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor
    2015-09-17 12:08:08 - Version 2 Made generic for HHS/GSA Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

 Note: for GSA:
 User must be created in both gsa-east-svcs and gsa-west-svcs ldap servers (10.151.231.10 and 10.141.231.10 respectively).   Users DN must be added to the gsa_vpn_user group via the member attribute.

 Note for HHS:
 Users DN must be added to the hhs_vpn_user group via the member attribute.

 example:

 member  uid=prigor,ou=people,dc=hhs,dc=local

 note:  The memberOf gsa_vpn_user/hhs_vpn_user operational attribute must be present for the user.

 Don't forget to add users to other groups based on their access requirements.

 Don't forget to send the user instructions on how to obtain their certificate and One-time-password token.

 To revoke a user - simply remove them from the gsa_vpn_user and/or hhs_vpn_user group.



=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: sophos install migrate troubleshooting
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Sophos Notes for Install, Migration or Troubleshooting

Revision History:
    2015-08-06 06:47:20 - Version 1 created by Paul Rigor

Details: (include steps to reproduce, symptoms, corrective actions, contact information, links and a any other helpful information)

  When installing, migrating or troubleshooting Sophos here are a few things to be aware of:

  * Ensure the source/destination check (AWS) is set to to false on both[all] interfaces. 
  * Ensure the security group(s) on the internal/private interface do not block traffic.  In most cases this should be "allow all" 
  * Ensure the routing table for private subnets is associated with the Sophos internal network interface.
  * When restoring a backup, the version of the backup must match the firmware version of Sophos.  If not, you will need to update or downgrade.

=================================================
This document is proprietary and confidential. No part of this document may be 
disclosed in any manner to a third party without the prior written consent of 
CTAC.```

item.title: Troubleshooting Sophos Jira issues
item.description:
Knowledge Base Article - CTAC (Communications Training Analysis Corporation)  
=================================================

Subject: Troubleshooting Sophos - Jira issues

When converting a LDAP account to Posix for the use of Sophos VPN


1) If user exists in LDAP take note of the users Employee ID and User name

2) Make sure to recreate the account with the same user name as before.

3) Generate a password for the user

4) After the account is created search for the DN on LDAP

5) if the account is available on jira_users group delete it 

6) Log in to JIRA, navigate to Administrator > User > Directory and sync the ldap.

7) Go back to LDAP and add the user back to the ira_users group 

8) Sync the Jira directory and search for the user to make sure it is available
